It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Blechum haughtii is considered a species of conservation concern.
